title: Private vs Public Law and a Doctor's Duty of Care - LawTeacher.net
snippet: Generally doctors owe a duty of care to their patients. A Hospital Trust would normally owe a duty of care to a patient of a doctor employed by the Trust. Outside a hospital or a doctor's surgery, for example at the scene of an accident, a doctor would not normally owe a duty of care if he did not attempt to help.
